body_html:
Hi, I'm also having a similar issue.
I changed my cifar-10 into binary classification with some adjustments, and it doesn't seem to be doing the right feature extraction as training step increases.
For my case, within 100 steps, the predicted class is all set to one label and shows no change after.
As I see my fully connected layer, I can see that the nodes are mostly dead to one value and the ones with distributed values are looking same.
I tried to lower my learning rate but have the same problem.
Any suggestions?

body:
Hi, I'm also having a similar issue. 
I changed my cifar-10 into binary classification with some adjustments, and it doesn't seem to be doing the right feature extraction as training step increases.
For my case, within 100 steps, the predicted class is all set to one label and shows no change after.
As I see my fully connected layer, I can see that the nodes are mostly dead to one value and the ones with distributed values are looking same.
I tried to lower my learning rate but have the same problem.
Any suggestions?
